name: ASPX FILE REFERENCE

description: Base64 string conversion operations, often used to decode malicious payloads

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #1: Mimikatz Download and Execute
description: Downloads and executes Mimikatz via PowerShell download cradle (Atomic Test #1)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #2: BloodHound from Local Disk
description: Executes BloodHound/SharpHound from local disk for AD enumeration (Atomic Test #2)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #3: BloodHound from Memory
description: Downloads and executes BloodHound directly from memory via download cradle (Atomic Test #3)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #4: Mimikatz via PsSendKeys
description: Executes Mimikatz using automated keystrokes via PsSendKeys technique (Atomic Test #4)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #5: Invoke-AppPathBypass
description: UAC bypass technique using application paths (Atomic Test #5)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #6: MsXml COM Object
description: Uses MsXml COM object for web requests and payload execution (Atomic Test #6)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #7: PowerShell XML Requests
description: Downloads and executes payload via XML document parsing (Atomic Test #7)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #8: PowerShell Invoke MSHTA
description: Uses MSHTA to execute JavaScript that downloads and runs PowerShell payload (Atomic Test #8)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #9: Invoke-DownloadCradle
description: Uses various download cradle techniques for payload delivery (Atomic Test #9)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #10: Fileless Script Execution
description: Executes PowerShell payload stored in Windows Registry (Atomic Test #10)

description: Stores and executes PowerShell code in NTFS Alternate Data Streams (Atomic Test #11)

description: Creates and uses remote PowerShell sessions (Atomic Test #12)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #13-16: Command Parameter Variations
description: Tests various PowerShell command-line parameter variations (Atomic Tests #13-16)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #17: Obfuscated PowerShell Execution
description: Executes heavily obfuscated PowerShell commands using Base64 encoding (Atomic Test #17)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #18: Malicious Cmdlets Simulation
description: Execution of known malicious PowerShell cmdlets from offensive frameworks (Atomic Test #18)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #19: PowerUp Invoke-AllChecks
description: Runs PowerUp privilege escalation checks (Atomic Test #19)

name: ATOMIC T1059.001 - Test #20: DNS Nslookup Abuse
description: Abuses nslookup and DNS TXT records for command execution (Atomic Test #20)

description: Uses SOAPHound to dump BloodHound data for AD reconnaissance (Atomic Test #21)

description: Uses SOAPHound to build enumeration cache for Active Directory (Atomic Test #22)
